ollama_generated:
5. Limited Disclosure Obligation.

The parties acknowledge that certain information disclosed during the course of this agreement may be confidential in nature. Each party agrees to exercise reasonable discretion in safeguarding such confidential information and limit its disclosure only to those who have a need to know, for purposes directly related to this agreement. However, each party shall not be responsible for any unintentional or accidental disclosure of the other party's confidential information.

original: 6. Intellectual Property, Inventions and Patents . CONSULTANT acknowledges that CONSULTANT’s rights in all discoveries, concepts, ideas, inventions, innovations, improvements, developments, methods, designs, analyses, drawings, reports, patent applications, copyrightable work and mask work (whether or not including any Proprietary Information) and all registrations or applications related thereto, all other proprietary information and all similar or related information (whether or not patentable) which relate to the Company’s actual or anticipated business, research and development or existing or future products or services and which were or are conceived, developed, contributed to or made or reduced to practice by CONSULTANT (whether alone or jointly with others) while under contract with the Company, whether before or after the date of this Agreement (“Work Product”), belong to the Company. CONSULTANT shall promptly disclose such Work Product to the Chief Executive Officer of the Company and, at the Company’s expense, perform all actions reasonably requested by the Chief Executive Officer of the Company (whether during or after the consultancy) to establish and confirm such ownership (including assignments, consents, powers of attorney and other instruments). CONSULTANT acknowledges that all copyrightable Work Product which is capable of being classified as “works made for hire” under the U.S. Copyright Act of 1976, as amended, shall be deemed “works made for hire” and that the Company shall be the author of, and own all rights therein. To the extent that any such copyrightable work is not a “work made for hire,” CONSULTANT hereby assigns and agrees to assign to the Company all right, title and interest, including a copyright, in and to such copyrightable work. Furthermore, CONSULTANT agrees to sign any written instrument of transfer for any rights relating to the Work Product which may be required to effect or evidence the assignment of rights in the Work Product to the Company. The foregoing provisions of this Section 6 shall not apply to any invention that CONSULTANT developed entirely on CONSULTANT’s own time without using the Company’s equipment, supplies, facilities or trade secret information, except for those inventions that (i) relate to the Company’s business or actual or demonstrably anticipated research or development, or (ii) result from any work performed by CONSULTANT for the Company.
modified: 6. Intellectual Property, Inventions and Patents . The Company acknowledges that all discoveries, concepts, ideas, inventions, innovations, improvements, developments, methods, designs, analyses, drawings, reports, patent applications, copyrightable work and mask work (whether or not including any Proprietary Information) and all registrations or applications related thereto, all other proprietary information and all similar or related information (whether or not patentable) which relate to the Consultant’s actual or anticipated business, research and development or existing or future products or services and which were or are conceived, developed, contributed to or made or reduced to practice by the Consultant (whether alone or jointly with others) during or after the consultancy period under this Agreement (“Work Product”), belong to the Consultant. The Consultant shall have the discretion to decide whether to disclose such Work Product to the Chief Executive Officer of the Company and, at the Consultant’s expense, perform all actions reasonably requested by the Chief Executive Officer of the Company (whether during or after the consultancy) to establish and confirm such ownership (including assignments, consents, powers of attorney and other instruments). The Company acknowledges that all copyrightable Work Product which is capable of being classified as “works made for hire” under the U.S. Copyright Act of 1976, as amended, shall be deemed “works made for hire” and that the Consultant shall be the author of, and own all rights therein. To the extent that any such copyrightable work is not a “work made for hire,” the Company hereby assigns and agrees to assign to the Consultant all right, title and interest, including a copyright, in and to such copyrightable work. Furthermore, the Consultant agrees to sign any written instrument of transfer for any rights relating to the Work Product which may be required to effect or evidence the assignment of rights in the Work Product to the Company. The foregoing provisions of this Section 6 shall apply only to inventions that (i) do not relate to the Company’s business or actual or demonstrably anticipated research or development, or (ii) do not result from any work performed by the Consultant for the Company.

original: (a) have any ownership interest in, or participate in the financing, operation, management or control of, any Competitor; or (b) engage in or perform services for any Competitor, if such services either (1) are the same as or similar to (individually or in the aggregate) the services CONSULTANT performed for the Company during its consultancy with the Company, or (2) are performed with respect to products or services of the Competitor that are competitive with the products or services provided by the Company with which CONSULTANT was involved during its consultancy with the Company or about which it received Proprietary Information during its consultancy with the Company.
ollama_generated:
(a) Possess any ownership stake, contribute to the funding, operate, manage, or exert control over, any entity that competes directly or indirectly with the Company, and/or provides services to such a Competitor; or (b) undertake or render services for a Competitor, if such services:

  1. Match or are substantially similar (either singularly or cumulatively) to the services provided by the Consultant for the Company during their consultancy period with us, or
  2. Are rendered in relation to products or services of the Competitor that are compatible with, or could reasonably be perceived as an alternative to, the products or services offered by the Company with which the Consultant was associated during their consultancy period with us, or for which they received Confidential Information during that same period.

original: 9.6 Governing Law; Jurisdiction.  This Agreement shall be interpreted, construed, governed, and enforced according to the laws of the Commonwealth of Virginia, without giving effect to its conflict of laws principles. The Parties hereby agree and consent that any and all causes of action arising under this Agreement shall only have jurisdiction and venue in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Virginia and/or the Circuit Court for Chesterfield County. Each of the parties consents to the jurisdiction and venue of either court for the resolution of all causes of action arising under this Agreement upon proper service of process.
modified:
9.6 Applicable Law and Jurisdiction. This Agreement shall be governed by, construed in accordance with, and its disputes resolved according to the laws of the Commonwealth of Virginia, disregarding any conflicting principles that may otherwise apply. The Parties unanimously agree and acknowledge that any claims or disputes stemming from this Agreement shall have exclusive jurisdiction and venue solely within the United States District Court for the Western District of Virginia and/or the Circuit Court for Henrico County. Each of the parties hereby grants consent to the jurisdiction and venue of either court in addressing all claims or disputes arising under this Agreement upon service of process deemed proper by applicable rules.

In this version, the jurisdiction and venue for resolving disputes has been shifted from Eastern District of Virginia and Chesterfield County to Western District of Virginia and Henrico County, respectively. This change may make it more difficult for a party to bring or defend claims due to the potential inconvenience of appearing in a court located further away.

original: 1. $200,000 annual fee payable in 12 equal monthly installments or 24 equal semi-monthly installments, at CONSULTANT’s election.
modified: 1. The ANNUAL FEE of $200,000 shall be divided into either 12 equal MONTHLY payments or 24 equal SEMI-MONTHLY payments, with the choice of payment schedule to be exercised by CLIENT, not CONSULTANT.
